attributes.name: hx-boost
attributes.description: The **hx-boost** attribute allows you to "boost" normal anchors and form tags to use AJAX instead. This has the [nice fallback](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Progressive_enhancement) that, if the user does not have javascript enabled, the site will continue to work.

attributes.name: hx-confirm
attributes.description: The **hx-confirm** attribute allows you to confirm an action before issuing a request. This can be useful in cases where the action is destructive and you want to ensure that the user really wants to do it.

attributes.name: hx-delete
attributes.description: The **hx-delete** attribute will cause an element to issue a **DELETE** to the specified URL and swap the HTML into the DOM using a swap strategy.

attributes.name: hx-disable
attributes.description: The **hx-disable** attribute disables htmx processing for the given node and any children nodes

attributes.name: hx-encoding
attributes.description: The **hx-encoding** attribute changes the request encoding type

attributes.name: hx-ext
attributes.description: The **hx-ext** attribute enables extensions for an element

attributes.name: hx-get
attributes.description: The **hx-get** attribute issues a `GET` to the specified URL

attributes.name: hx-headers
attributes.description: The **hx-headers** attribute adds to the headers that will be submitted with the request

attributes.name: hx-history-elt
attributes.description: The **hx-history-elt** attribute specifies the element to snapshot and restore during history navigation

attributes.name: hx-include
attributes.description: The **hx-include** attribute specifies additional values/inputs to include in AJAX requests

attributes.name: hx-indicator
attributes.description: The **hx-indicator** attribute specifies the element to put the `htmx-request` class on during the AJAX request, displaying it as a request indicator

attributes.name: hx-disinherit
attributes.description: The **hx-disinherit** attribute allows you to control and disable automatic attribute inheritance for child nodes

attributes.name: hx-params
attributes.description: The **hx-params** attribute allows you filter the parameters that will be submitted with a request

attributes.name: hx-patch
attributes.description: The **hx-patch** attribute issues a `PATCH` to the specified URL

attributes.name: hx-post
attributes.description: The **hx-post** attribute issues a `POST` to the specified URL

attributes.name: hx-preserve
attributes.description: The **hx-preserve** attribute preserves an element between requests (requires the `id` be stable)

attributes.name: hx-prompt
attributes.description: The **hx-prompt** attribute shows a prompt before submitting a request

attributes.name: hx-push-url
attributes.description: The **hx-push-url** attribute pushes the URL into the location bar, creating a new history entry

attributes.name: hx-put
attributes.description: The **hx-put** attribute issues a `PUT` to the specified URL

attributes.name: hx-request
attributes.description: The **hx-request** attribute configures various aspects of the request

attributes.name: hx-select
attributes.description: The **hx-select** attribute selects a subset of the server response to process

attributes.name: hx-sse
attributes.description: The **hx-sse** attribute connects the DOM to a SSE source

attributes.name: hx-swap-oob
attributes.description: The **hx-swap-oob** attribute marks content in a response as being "Out of Band", i.e. swapped somewhere other than the target

attributes.name: hx-swap
attributes.description: The **hx-swap** attribute controls how the response content is swapped into the DOM (e.g. 'outerHTML' or 'beforeend')

attributes.name: hx-sync
attributes.description: The **hx-sync** attribute controls requests made by different elements are synchronized with one another

attributes.name: hx-target
attributes.description: The **hx-target** attribute specifies the target element to be swapped

attributes.name: hx-trigger
attributes.description: The **hx-trigger** attribute specifies specifies the event that triggers the request

attributes.name: hx-vals
attributes.description: The **hx-vals** attribute specifies values to add to the parameters that will be submitted with the request in JSON form

attributes.name: hx-vars
attributes.description: The **hx-vars** attribute specifies computed values to add to the parameters that will be submitted with the request

attributes.name: hx-ws
attributes.description: The **hx-ws** attribute  connects the DOM to a Web Socket source

classes.name: htmx-added
classes.description: Applied to a new piece of content before it is swapped, removed after it is settled.

classes.name: htmx-indicator
classes.description: A dynamically generated class that will toggle visible (opacity:1) when a `htmx-request` class is present.

classes.name: htmx-request
classes.description: Applied to either the element or the element specified with `hx-indicator` while a request is ongoing.

classes.name: htmx-settling
classes.description: Applied to a target after content is swapped, removed after it is settled. The duration can be modified via `hx-swap`.

classes.name: htmx-swapping
classes.description: Applied to a target before any content is swapped, removed after it is swapped. The duration can be modified via `hx-swap`.
